p: To measure the pausing positions when unfolding a hairpin construct in strand-separation assays, we performed zero-correction for each trace by subtracting the bead height where the hairpin fully opened at the force of F test. After zero-correction at F test, the resulting change in extensions represents the length of ssDNA released while unfolding a hairpin. In a histogram for the extension of each trace, peaks at specific extension indicate the blockage of hairpin opening due to TRF1 binding.
